brief_description: The historic capital of the Auvergne region, Clermont-Ferrand is a city of volcanic heritage where medieval architecture meets modern innovation. With its distinctive black volcanic stone buildings, the iconic Notre-Dame-du-Port basilica, and its role as the birthplace of the Michelin tire company, Clermont-Ferrand offers visitors a unique blend of French charm and industrial heritage.

sections.title: Volcanic Heritage
sections.content: Clermont-Ferrand's unique character is defined by its volcanic origins, with the city built on ancient lava flows from the nearby Chaîne des Puys volcanoes. The distinctive black volcanic stone (pierre de Volvic) used in many buildings creates a striking architectural identity that sets the city apart from other French cities, while the surrounding volcanic landscape offers spectacular natural beauty.

sections.title: Medieval Legacy
sections.content: The city's rich medieval history is preserved in landmarks like the Romanesque Notre-Dame-du-Port basilica, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and the historic Place de Jaude. These structures tell the story of Clermont-Ferrand's importance as a religious and cultural center during the Middle Ages, with architecture that reflects the city's spiritual significance.

sections.title: Industrial Innovation
sections.content: Clermont-Ferrand is globally recognized as the birthplace of the Michelin tire company, which has shaped the city's modern identity. The company's headquarters and research facilities continue to drive innovation, while the city has evolved into a center for technology and research, balancing industrial heritage with contemporary development.

sections.title: Auvergnat Culture
sections.content: Clermont-Ferrand embodies the warm hospitality and rich traditions of the Auvergne region. Visitors experience this through traditional Auvergnat cuisine featuring local specialties like truffade and Cantal cheese, the lively atmosphere of local markets, and the genuine friendliness of residents who are proud to share their city's unique story.

why_visit.intro: Clermont-Ferrand offers visitors a unique opportunity to experience a French city that combines medieval charm with volcanic landscapes and industrial innovation, featuring authentic local culture, fascinating history, and a distinctive architectural character that's unlike anywhere else in France.

highlights.title: Volcanic Stone Architecture
highlights.content: Clermont-Ferrand's distinctive black volcanic stone buildings create a unique urban landscape that's become the city's signature feature. The dark stone transforms ordinary structures into striking architectural statements, making every street corner a potential photo opportunity and creating a dramatic atmosphere throughout the city.

highlights.title: Place de Jaude
highlights.content: The heart of Clermont-Ferrand, this expansive square is surrounded by important landmarks including the Notre-Dame-du-Port basilica, the Michelin headquarters, and the modern Jaude shopping center. It's the perfect starting point for exploring the city and experiencing the daily life of Clermont-Ferrand's residents.

highlights.title: Notre-Dame-du-Port
highlights.content: This magnificent Romanesque basilica, a UNESCO World Heritage site, showcases the city's medieval heritage with its stunning architecture and religious significance. The church's design and construction techniques represent the pinnacle of Romanesque architecture in the Auvergne region.

highlights.title: Historic Center
highlights.content: Clermont-Ferrand's medieval center offers authentic local experiences where visitors can explore narrow cobblestone streets, discover hidden courtyards, and admire the distinctive black stone architecture. The area is particularly atmospheric in the evening when the volcanic stone takes on a mysterious quality.

highlights.title: Puy de Dôme
highlights.content: Just outside the city, the iconic Puy de Dôme volcano offers spectacular views of Clermont-Ferrand and the surrounding Chaîne des Puys volcanic chain. Accessible by train or hiking trails, it provides a natural escape and opportunities for outdoor activities in a unique volcanic landscape.

highlights.title: Michelin Heritage
highlights.content: The city's industrial heritage is celebrated through the Michelin company's presence, with the Michelin Adventure museum offering insights into the company's history and innovation. This industrial legacy adds a unique dimension to the city's cultural landscape.

transport.public_transport: Clermont-Ferrand has an efficient tram and bus system that serves the city and surrounding areas. Taxis are readily available and the city center is compact and walkable, making it easy to explore on foot.
transport.passes: Single tickets and day passes are available for public transport. The city center is easily navigable on foot, with most major attractions within walking distance.

spring.description: Spring brings pleasant temperatures and blooming flowers to Clermont-Ferrand, making it an ideal time to explore the city on foot. The weather is comfortable for outdoor activities, and the surrounding volcanic landscape comes to life with seasonal colors.

summer.description: Summer in Clermont-Ferrand is pleasant, with the city's many parks and the nearby Puy de Dôme providing cool retreats. Evening temperatures are comfortable, making it perfect for enjoying the city's vibrant café culture and outdoor dining scene.

autumn.description: Autumn offers mild temperatures and beautiful fall colors, particularly in the surrounding volcanic landscape. The weather is ideal for exploring the city and nearby natural attractions, with fewer crowds than the summer months.

winter.description: Winter in Clermont-Ferrand can be cold and snowy, especially in the surrounding mountains. The city takes on a cozy atmosphere, with indoor attractions like museums and the historic center providing warm refuge. The nearby mountains offer winter sports opportunities.
